### getRegisterInfo() {#ad3bd3fe505c567813b9483a818a3b58c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SparcRegisterInfo &amp; llvm::SparcInstrInfo::getRegisterInfo () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
getRegisterInfo - <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetinstrinfo">TargetInstrInfo</a> is a superset of MRegister info.

As such, whenever a client has an instance of instruction info, it should always be able to get register info as well (through this method).

### isLoadFromStackSlot() {#ac495e206cf48199c4960b2f41adbf4b2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register SparcInstrInfo::isLoadFromStackSlot (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, int &amp; FrameIndex) const</>}>
isLoadFromStackSlot - If the specified machine instruction is a direct load from a stack slot, return the virtual or physical register number of the destination along with the FrameIndex of the loaded stack slot.

If not, return 0. This predicate must return 0 if the instruction has any side effects other than loading from the stack slot.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/sparc/sparcinstrinfo-h/#l00056">56</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/sparc/sparcinstrinfo-h">SparcInstrInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/sparc/sparcinstrinfo-cpp/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/sparc/sparcinstrinfo-cpp">SparcInstrInfo.cpp</a>.

### isStoreToStackSlot() {#a49dc65f66c9f7a08af329b19fd836bd7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register SparcInstrInfo::isStoreToStackSlot (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, int &amp; FrameIndex) const</>}>
isStoreToStackSlot - If the specified machine instruction is a direct store to a stack slot, return the virtual or physical register number of the source reg along with the FrameIndex of the loaded stack slot.

If not, return 0. This predicate must return 0 if the instruction has any side effects other than storing to the stack slot.
